<Link id="l00019" /><CodeLine lineNumber="19"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// OpenCL uses address spaces to differentiate between</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00020" /><CodeLine lineNumber="20"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// various memory regions on the hardware. On the CPU</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00021" /><CodeLine lineNumber="21"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// all of the address spaces point to the same memory,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00022" /><CodeLine lineNumber="22"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// however on the GPU, each address space points to</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00023" /><CodeLine lineNumber="23"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// a separate piece of memory that is unique from other</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00024" /><CodeLine lineNumber="24"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// memory locations.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00025" /><CodeLine lineNumber="25" lineLink="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/amdgpuas"><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">namespace </span><span class="doxyHighlight"><a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/amdgpuas">AMDGPUAS</a> &#123;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00026" /><CodeLine lineNumber="26"><span class="doxyHighlight">enum : </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">unsigned</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> &#123;</span></CodeLine>
